PATIENT_ID: TEST_HYPO_EDGE_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-21 01:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-21 01:05:00
Category I trauma activation for 28-year-old male found down in snow.
Mechanism: assault with blunt weapon followed by prolonged cold exposure.
Patient found unresponsive in below-freezing conditions.
BP 70/40, HR 45, RR 8.
temp 28.5C.
Severe hypothermia. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation initiated.
Temperature measured within 5 minutes of arrival.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-21 01:15:00
Active warming initiated: Bair Hugger, warm IV fluids, warmed humidified oxygen.
Repeat temperature at 01:15: 29.2C.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-21 01:30:00
Serial temperature recheck: 30.1C at 01:30.
Warming measures continued aggressively.
Trauma surgeon notified of temperature 28.5C on arrival - severe hypothermia.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-21 02:00:00
Temperature at 02:00: 32.4C.
Patient regaining consciousness. Heart rate improving to 62.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-21 02:30:00
Repeat temperature at 02:30: 34.1C.
Warming continued. Patient responsive to commands.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-21 03:00:00
Temperature now 35.5C. Patient stable and responsive.
Hypothermia protocol followed. Serial temperatures documented per protocol.
